required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Middle Ear Implant: Assessment of Satisfaction in the Medium Term
clinical_study.official_title: Middle Ear Implant: Assessment of Satisfaction in the Medium Term

brief_summary.textblock:
Currently, the data from the literature do not evaluate the use of the middle ear implant in implanted patients in the medium term (10 years and over) but only in the short term (1-5 years).
Based on the observation of the absence of these data, we considered it necessary to evaluate in the medium term the satisfaction of the patients carrying a middle ear implant and their rate of abandonment with a horizon of 10 to 20 years of apparatus.

primary_outcome.description: calculate the rate of patient having abandonment the Use of Middle Ear Implant

intervention.description: Interview patient without scoring about the reasons for the implant, the complications, the reasons for abandonment, the evaluation of the satisfaction

study_pop.textblock: all living patients who have benefited from the placement of a middle ear implant since 1998 at Hospices Civils of Lyon.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age â‰¥ 18 years
- Patient accepting to participate to this study
- Patient having a middle ear implant since 10 - 20 years at time of inclusion
Exclusion Criteria:
- patient not dead

overall_official.affiliation: Service de chirurgie ORL et cervico faciale
